title: An Exploratory Evaluation of the Tau Protein Binding Properties, Whole-Body Biodistribution and Safety of 18F-AV-1451 Injection in Healthy Volunteers and Cognitively Impaired Subjects
description_brief: This early phase 1 study explored the brain uptake, retention, and safety of flortaucipir and obtained preliminary information regarding dosimetry of flortaucipir.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Subjects enrolled in the MRI/amyloid extension cohort were to be combined with the Brain PET subgroups for analysis per protocol. MRI allows previously-obtained flortaucipir scan and cognitive data to be combined with the PET scan results from the Brain PET subgroups for analysis.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Enrollment occurred between Aug and Dec 2013. Subjects in the MRI and Amyloid Extension cohort received flortaucipir brain PET scans in Study T807000 (NCT01733355)

outcomeMeasures.title: Brain Flortaucipir Uptake
outcomeMeasures.description: Brain imaging of tau in healthy volunteers and subjects with cognitive impairment. Standard uptake value ratios (SUVr), normalized to the entire cerebellum. A global cortical average volume of interest (VOI) is the average SUVr of the occipital cortex, parietal cortex, and temporal cortex. For SUVr, a value of 1 signifies no flortaucipir activity above background, values greater than 1 signify increasing flortaucipir activity in the brain.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Includes quantitative flortaucipir PET scan results from subjects with a flortaucipir scan in the present study (n=15), plus subjects consented in the MRI/Amyloid extension cohort who provided valid flortaucipir PET scans (n=3 AD, n=2 MCI, n=1 OCN) and received MRI in the present study permitting quantitative analysis per protocol.

groups.title: Brain PET Scan (AD Subjects)
groups.description: AD subjects receiving a flortaucipir and florbetapir PET scan

groups.title: Brain PET (MCI Subjects)
groups.description: Mild cognitive impairment (MCI) subjects receiving a florbetapir and a flortaucipir PET scan

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir Whole Body Effective Dose
outcomeMeasures.description: Radiation dose estimates measured in millisieverts per megabecquerel (mSv/MBq) for the whole body obtained from Organ Level Internal Dose Assessment/Exponential Modeling (OLINDA/EXM) radiation dosimetry code. Results calculated using 73.7-kg man model.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Includes only subjects from the whole body PET scan group (n=9)

groups.title: Whole Body Flortaucipir PET Scan
groups.description: Subjects receiving a whole body PET scan after flortaucipir administration

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir PET Correlations With Cognitive Assessments (Mini-mental State Exam)
outcomeMeasures.description: Spearman's correlations between flortaucipir SUVr and cognitive function as measured on the Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE). MMSE is a 30-point questionnaire that is used to measure cognitive impairment. 0 is the lowest score and 30 is the highest score, indicating normal cognitive function. Lower MMSE scores indicate worsening cognitive function. For this analysis, negative correlation values indicate that higher flortaucipir uptake is associated with decreasing cognitive function and positive correlation values indicate that lower flortaucipir uptake is associated with better cognitive function. 95% confidence interval uses a Fisher's z transformation.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Includes quantitative flortaucipir brain PET scan results from subjects with a flortaucipir scan in the present study (n=15), plus subjects consented in the MRI/Amyloid extension cohort who provided valid flortaucipir PET scans from a previous study (n=6) and received MRI in the present study permitting quantitation per protocol.

groups.title: All Subjects/Brain PET
groups.description: Includes all AD, MCI, YCN, and OCN subjects enrolled in the study with flortaucipir Brain PET scans

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir PET Correlations With Cognitive Assessments Cognitive Assessments (Digit Symbol Substitution Test)
outcomeMeasures.description: Spearman's correlations between flortaucipir SUVr and cognitive function as measured on Digit Symbol Substitution Test (DSST). The DSST is sensitive to the presence of cognitive dysfunction as well as to change in cognitive function. Scores range from 0 to 133. Lower DSST scores indicate worsening cognitive function. For this analysis, negative correlation values indicate that higher flortaucipir uptake is associated with decreasing cognitive function and positive correlation values indicate that lower flortaucipir uptake is associated with better cognitive function. 95% confidence interval uses a Fisher's z transformation.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Includes quantitative flortaucipir PET scan results from subjects with a flortaucipir scan in the present study (n=15), plus subjects consented in the MRI/Amyloid extension cohort who provided valid flortaucipir PET scans from a previous study n=6) and received MRI in the present study permitting quantitation per protocol.

groups.title: All Subjects/Brain PET
groups.description: Includes all AD, MCI, YCN, and OCN subjects enrolled in the study with flortaucipir Brain PET scans

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir PET Correlations With Cognitive Assessments Cognitive Assessments (Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale)
outcomeMeasures.description: Spearman's correlations between flortaucipir SUVr and cognitive function as measured on a Modified Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale (ADAS)-Cognitive subscale (including orientation, verbal memory, language, and praxis, minus the spoken language assessment). Scores on the modified scale can range from 0 to 65. Higher scores indicate worsening cognitive function. For this analysis, positive correlation values indicate that higher flortaucipir uptake is associated with decreasing cognitive function and negative correlation values indicate that lower flortaucipir uptake is associated with better cognitive function. 95% confidence interval uses a Fisher's z transformation.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Includes quantitative flortaucipir PET scan results from subjects with a flortaucipir scan in the present study (n=15), plus subjects consented in the MRI/Amyloid extension cohort who provided valid flortaucipir PET scans from a previous study (n=6) and received MRI in the present study permitting quantitation per protocol.

groups.title: All Subjects/Brain PET
groups.description: Includes all AD, MCI, YCN, and OCN subjects enrolled in the study with flortaucipir Brain PET scans

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir Whole Body Effective Dose With Urine Radioactivity
outcomeMeasures.description: Radiation dose estimates measured in millisieverts per megabecquerel (mSv/MBq) for the whole body obtained from Organ Level Internal Dose Assessment/Exponential Modeling (OLINDA/EXM) radiation dosimetry code. Results calculated using 73.7-kg man model and accounting for total integrated radioactivity excreted in the urine collected in Study A15 (NCT02336360)
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Includes only subjects from the whole body PET scan group (n=9)

groups.title: Whole Body Flortaucipir PET Scan
groups.description: Subjects receiving a whole body PET scan after flortaucipir administration

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: End of study for AE reporting was 48 hours after the last study drug administration.
adverseEventsModule.description: Adverse Events were defined as occurring or worsening after injection of dose, within 48 hours post injection of florbetapir or flortaucipir. AEs occurring after study drug administration, but outside that window were not recorded in the database, unless considered attributable to study drug injection. MRI/Amyloid extension cohort n=4 represents only those subjects receiving florbetapir PET scans.

explanation_target: Reason: The trial description and title state this was an early phase 1 study of brain uptake, retention, safety and whole‑body dosimetry of flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451), which are endpoints of a PET radiotracer imaging study rather than a therapeutic intervention. citeturn0search4turn0search8

Act: Flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451, also known as AV‑1451 or 18F‑T807) is an F‑18 radiolabeled PET tracer used to image aggregated tau neurofibrillary tangles in the brain; it is a diagnostic imaging agent (marketed as TAUVID) and not a disease‑modifying drug. The trial’s focus on biodistribution and dosimetry confirms it is evaluating an imaging agent. citeturn0search0turn0search6

Reflect: Because flortaucipir is a PET radiopharmaceutical for tau imaging (diagnostic) and the study endpoints are uptake/retention/safety/dosimetry, the trial does not fit the four therapeutic categories (disease‑targeted biologic, disease‑targeted small molecule, cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric symptom improvement). Therefore the correct classification is 'N/A'. Note: flortaucipir binds paired helical filament (PHF) tau in AD but has known off‑target or limited binding in some non‑AD tauopathies, which supports its role as a diagnostic tracer rather than a therapy. citeturn0search2turn0search3

- TAUVID (flortaucipir F‑18 injection) product information — FDA/ manufacturer resource describing flortaucipir as an FDA‑approved PET tracer to estimate aggregated tau NFT deposition. citeturn0search0
- Journal of Nuclear Medicine / meeting report describing flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451) as an investigational PET radiopharmaceutical with recommended dosing and imaging parameters. citeturn0search4

- Brain / multicenter longitudinal study and other publications describing 18F‑AV‑1451 (flortaucipir) PET imaging in normal aging, MCI and AD, and its use as a tau biomarker. citeturn0search8turn0search6

- PubMed / autoradiography and neuropathology studies noting limited or off‑target binding of AV‑1451 in some non‑AD tauopathies (e.g., CTE), supporting interpretation as a diagnostic tracer with binding‑profile caveats. citeturn0search2
